PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main goal of this thesis is to study the dispersion trading strategy applied for the Brazilian options equity market. Some studies for developed markets show that implied correlation tends to be priced higher than the realized correlation. In order to verify and capture this difference, dispersion trading strategy can be used to trade index volatility versus the volatility of its components. Brazilian options market does not present enough liquidity to trade stock options in all index components. Given that, an index tracking approach is presented to create an index proxy that tries to replicate the index return with a small subset of components. This thesis explores multi-period strategies and different compositions for the index proxy portfolio in order to verify if the strategy is consistent. The results provide strong evidence that dispersion trading is feasible to be im- plemented, being profitable even with positive transaction costs.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Apreamento da Convexidade de Derivativos Indexados ao Percentual do CDI no Modelo de Black-Derman-Toy
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Devido caracterstica estocstica das taxas de juros e ao efeito composto da composio do fator dirio de derivativos indexados ao percentual do CDI, os derivativos indexados a percentuais do CDI diferentes de 100% possuem intrinsecamente tanto risco de delta quanto risco de convexidade (ou gamma) quanto s oscilaes da taxa de juros de mercado. Enquanto o primeiro risco corretamente mensurado pelo mercado, o segundo risco segue sendo ignorado no apreamento desses derivativos. A convexidade deles tanto maior quanto mais longo o vencimento do mesmo, quanto mais distantes de 100%CDI eles estiverem indexados e quanto mais elevados tanto os nveis de taxas de juros de mercado quanto suas volatilidades. De forma a precificarmos corretamente os mesmos precisamos incorporar ao apreamento de mercado um prmio que chamaremos de prmio de convexidade. Esse prmio se refere ao resultado esperado pela marcao a mercado desses derivativos, que ser diferente de zero, quando o risco de delta dinamicamente neutralizado atravs de contratos futuros de DI. Utilizamos o modelo de Black-Derman-Toy para estimarmos esses prmios para diversos valores de percentual do CDI, diversos cenrios de volatilidade das taxas de juros e para diversas maturidades do derivativo. Os resultados se mostraram bastantes consistentes com nossas simulaes, sendo muito relevantes para o perodo atual de alta volatilidade, notadamente para derivativos acima de cinco anos e percentuais do CDI acima de 150%. Por fim, nosso modelo foi validado estimando milhares de cenrios atravs de simulaes de Monte Carlo para as oscilaes do CDI e da taxa de juros de mercado, assim como para avaliar a estratgia de delta hedge dinmico mais eficiente para o comprador ou vendedor de convexidade.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Due to the stochastic feature of interest rates and the compound effect of the composition of the daily factor of derivatives indexed to the CDI, derivatives indexed to a CDI percentage other than 100% inherently possess both delta risk as convexity risk (or gamma) regarding fluctuations in market interest rates. While the first risk is properly measured by the market, the second risk remains ignored in the pricing of these derivatives. In order to properly price them we need to incorporate to the market price a premium that we?ll call convexity premium. This premium refers to the expected result by the marking to market of these derivatives, which will be different from zero, when the delta risk is dynamically neutralized through DI futures contracts. We use the model of Black-Derman-Toy to estimate these premiums in many CDI percentages, in several volatility scenarios of interest rates and for many derivative maturities. The results were quite consistent with our simulations, being very relevant to the current period of high volatility, particularly for derivatives over five years and CDI percentages above 150%. Finally, our model was validated by estimating thousands of scenarios through Monte Carlo simulations to the fluctuations of the CDI rate and the market interest rate, as well as to evaluate the most efficient dynamic delta hedge strategy for the buyer or seller of convexity.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O modelos matemticos, economtricos e estatsticos servem para precificar derivativos financeiros e auxiliar na gesto de riscos de bancos e empresas. Este projeto de pesquisa visa explorar particularidades do mercado financeiro brasileiro que no so contempladas pela literatura internacional, capacitando e formando dentro desta temtica, tanto pesquisadores, tcnicos e especialistas que atuam na academia, quanto em bancos e empresas. Do ponto de vista institucional, espera-se que este projeto torne-se uma parte importante do Centro de Finanas do Instituto de Ensino e Pesquisa (Insper - SP), o que contribuir substancialmente para a difuso do conhecimento entre os discentes do curso de Economia e reas afins. O projeto no tem previso de celebrao de contratos e convnios com empresas no presente momento, mas espera-se que, conforme os modelos sejam desenvolvidos, a implementao de parcerias do Insper com bancos e empresas ocorra pronta e seguramente. Isso contribuir tanto para o fortalecimento do Centro de Finanas do Insper quanto para a melhor administrao de riscos no mercado financeiro brasileiro.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The mathematical, statistical and econometric models are used to price financial derivatives and assist banks and companies in risk management. This research project aims to explore particularities of the Brazilian financial market that are not covered by international literature, training and forming within this theme, both researchers, technicians and specialists working in the academy, as banks and companies. From the institutional point of view, it is expected that this project will become an important part of the Center for Finance at the Institute of Education and Research (Insper - SP), which will contribute substantially to the diffusion of knowledge among the students of the course of Economics and related fields. The project has not concluded forecast contracts and agreements with companies at present, but it is expected that, as the models are developed, the implementation of Insper partnerships with banks and companies will occur promptly and safely. This will help both to strengthen the Finance Insper Center and for better risk management in the Brazilian financial market.
